messages: c3fbed2485f9d0c67bb1f48904f47339 (07:41): can someonehelp me with this http://erxz.com/pb/1968 ? It works fine in FF but in IE i keep getting NaN errors
5e22a39ccf920b270a88def51d3be172 (07:44): ajay, alert(picnic.value); before you assign it
c3fbed2485f9d0c67bb1f48904f47339 (07:46): thats strange
c3fbed2485f9d0c67bb1f48904f47339 (07:46): it's showing up blank
c3fbed2485f9d0c67bb1f48904f47339 (07:47): are there any problems with passing in this  in a function in an event in IE?
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (07:47): what's 'picnic'?
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (07:48): ajay:  no
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (07:48): what's 'picnic'?
c3fbed2485f9d0c67bb1f48904f47339 (07:48): picnic is "this" passed in in an onchange in a dropdown
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (07:49): ok, so is the evented node
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (07:49): well, looks fine to me :|
c3fbed2485f9d0c67bb1f48904f47339 (07:49): is there something different that needs to be done for in IE to get the value of it?
9034cf48aef366fb4a215175085330de (07:49): http:www.devmatrix.org")
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (07:49): what error are you getting and when?
c3fbed2485f9d0c67bb1f48904f47339 (07:50): when i change something, it's saying NaN when assigning the value
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (07:50): ajay:  no, provided the evented node is an input and has a .vaule property
c3fbed2485f9d0c67bb1f48904f47339 (07:50): the evented node is a select
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (07:51): then it DOESN'T have a .value property
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (07:51): its options do, not the select itself
c3fbed2485f9d0c67bb1f48904f47339 (07:51): what does a select have?
c3fbed2485f9d0c67bb1f48904f47339 (07:51): so how can I find the value of the chosen option?
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (07:51): it has an options collection, each has a value
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (07:52): in geckos, yes, you can do SELECTELEMENT.value and it references the selected option's value
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (07:52): It may be a multiple select, so a single value doesn't make sense
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (07:52): which I don't think is standard
c3fbed2485f9d0c67bb1f48904f47339 (07:53): but  how can you find the value of the selected option in IE though?
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (07:53): ajay:  you iterate the options collection of the select element
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (07:53): same works on all browsers really
c3fbed2485f9d0c67bb1f48904f47339 (07:54): yea but if I iterate through em how can I tell which one was selected?
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (07:54): ajay:  SELECTHERE.options[SELECTHERE.selectedIndex].value
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (07:54): ajay: stop at the first one you find which is selected
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (07:54): ajay:  you said you had multiple?
c3fbed2485f9d0c67bb1f48904f47339 (07:54): no it's a single select
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (07:54): if there's more than one, you have to iterate
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (07:55): ohhh ok
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (07:55): ajay:  SELECTHERE.options[SELECTHERE.selectedIndex].value   <---
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (07:55): that gets it
c3fbed2485f9d0c67bb1f48904f47339 (07:55): ok sweet thanks
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (07:55): same works on all browsers really
c3fbed2485f9d0c67bb1f48904f47339 (07:56): ok cool. i was looking through docs for the select tag and wasn't really finding anything on getting the value
cbdf49a5fef7fce7431fc7ee349f78bd (07:57): Is there a way to trigger a function when the page loads, without using onload in <body>?
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (07:57): window.onload
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (07:57): ohh the page...
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (07:58): stick it at the bottom of the page :) and say document.body.onload=YOURFUNCTION;
cbdf49a5fef7fce7431fc7ee349f78bd (07:58): that works :)
cbdf49a5fef7fce7431fc7ee349f78bd (07:58): well I hope anyway, I'll try, thanks :)
ac4f21d2f076fa4cfa83ebd6950c4c7e (07:58): does anyone know how to override oncontextmenu for just a div or anchor?
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (07:59): yes and no
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (07:59): oncontextmenu="mystuff()"
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (08:00): however, some browsers by default nowadays are not allowing access to the right-click menu
c3fbed2485f9d0c67bb1f48904f47339 (08:00): hey by SELECTHERE you mean picnic in my case?
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (08:00): ajay:  yes
ac4f21d2f076fa4cfa83ebd6950c4c7e (08:00): i can get document.oncontextmenu = function () {return false;} to stop it for the whole document
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (08:00): [1]Andrew:  ie, geckos, geckos install with 'do not allow access to context menu'
ac4f21d2f076fa4cfa83ebd6950c4c7e (08:00): but I can't enable it for the document and turn it off for a div
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (08:00): unless the user goes into preferences and js section and changes it
ac4f21d2f076fa4cfa83ebd6950c4c7e (08:00): I'm only concerned with IE actually
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (08:01): [1]Andrew:  then use oncontextmenu :)
ac4f21d2f076fa4cfa83ebd6950c4c7e (08:01): i did
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (08:01): ehheh
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (08:01): you may have to do a return false
ac4f21d2f076fa4cfa83ebd6950c4c7e (08:01): it only turns off the oncontextmenu for the whole document
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (08:01): I don't think so, lemme check my refs
ac4f21d2f076fa4cfa83ebd6950c4c7e (08:02): I just want it to be effective for a link, or at least a div wrapping a link
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (08:02): nope
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (08:02): [1]Andrew:  oncontextmenu	Fires when the user clicks the right mouse button in the client area, opening the context menu.
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (08:02): there, from the Div object refs
c3fbed2485f9d0c67bb1f48904f47339 (08:03): ummm i did parseInt(picnic.options[picnic.selectedIndex].value) and it still returns as NaN
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (08:03): so it does it for element interface
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (08:03): ajay:  what's the value in the selected option?
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (08:04): that code looks good to me
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (08:04): so, I'd think the NaN bit occurrs elsewhere
c3fbed2485f9d0c67bb1f48904f47339 (08:04): but when i try alerting that, i get NaN
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (08:04): right
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (08:05): is not there though, is coming from elsewhere or so.... got an url for it?
c3fbed2485f9d0c67bb1f48904f47339 (08:05): http://www.statc.net/dempsey/new/screen4.htm
c3fbed2485f9d0c67bb1f48904f47339 (08:05): any of the drop downs with the numbers
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (08:07): <option>1</option>   <---
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (08:07): there's no .value or   value="1"
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (08:07): thus
c3fbed2485f9d0c67bb1f48904f47339 (08:07): yeah.. i just realized that
c3fbed2485f9d0c67bb1f48904f47339 (08:07): wow i'm a dumbass
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (08:08): you can still grab the 1 by using .text instead
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (08:08): but not sure it's what you'd need ^_^, usually a descritive text with a relevant value works better
c3fbed2485f9d0c67bb1f48904f47339 (08:09): yeah. thanks man. I really appreciate it
c3fbed2485f9d0c67bb1f48904f47339 (08:10): now I can finally go out and enjoy my saturday night :)
